trans-unit.source: Build your first Azure Data Factory pipeline using Data Factory Editor
trans-unit.target: Build your first Azure Data Factory pipeline using Data Factory Editor

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will create a sample Azure Data Factory pipeline using Data Factory Editor in the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will create a sample Azure Data Factory pipeline using Data Factory Editor in the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to use the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title> to create your first pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to use the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title> to create your first pipeline.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial consists of the following steps:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial consists of the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Creating the data factory
trans-unit.target: Creating the data factory

trans-unit.source: Creating the linked services (data stores, computes) and datasets
trans-unit.target: Creating the linked services (data stores, computes) and datasets

trans-unit.source: Creating the pipeline
trans-unit.target: Creating the pipeline

trans-unit.source: This article does not provide a conceptual overview of the Azure Data Factory service.
trans-unit.target: This article does not provide a conceptual overview of the Azure Data Factory service.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed overview of the service, see the <linkText>Introduction to Azure Data Factory</linkText><title></title> article.
trans-unit.target: For a detailed overview of the service, see the <linkText>Introduction to Azure Data Factory</linkText><title></title> article.

trans-unit.source: After logging into the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>, do the following:
trans-unit.target: After logging into the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal</linkText><title></title>, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click NEW on the left menu.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW on the left menu.

trans-unit.source: Click Data analytics in the Create blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Data analytics in the Create blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Data Factory on the Data analytics blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Data Factory on the Data analytics blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New data factory blade, enter DataFactoryMyFirstPipeline for the Name.
trans-unit.target: In the New data factory blade, enter DataFactoryMyFirstPipeline for the Name.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New data factory blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New data factory blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory names are globally unique.
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory names are globally unique.

trans-unit.source: You will need to prefix the name of the data factory with your name, to enable the successful creation of the factory.
trans-unit.target: You will need to prefix the name of the data factory with your name, to enable the successful creation of the factory.

trans-unit.source: If you have not created any resource group, you will need to create a resource group.
trans-unit.target: If you have not created any resource group, you will need to create a resource group.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Click on RESOURCE GROUP NAME.
trans-unit.target: Click on RESOURCE GROUP NAME.

trans-unit.source: Select Create a new resource group in the Resource group blade.
trans-unit.target: Select Create a new resource group in the Resource group blade.

trans-unit.source: Enter ADF for the Name in the Create resource group blade.
trans-unit.target: Enter ADF for the Name in the Create resource group blade.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create resource group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create resource group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After you have selected the resource group, verify that you are using the correct subscription where you want the data factory to be created.
trans-unit.target: After you have selected the resource group, verify that you are using the correct subscription where you want the data factory to be created.

trans-unit.source: Click Create on the New data factory blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Create on the New data factory blade.

trans-unit.source: You will see the data factory being created in the Startboard of the Azure Preview Portal as follows:
trans-unit.target: You will see the data factory being created in the Startboard of the Azure Preview Portal as follows:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating data factory status</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating data factory status</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You have successfully created your first data factory.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully created your first data factory.

trans-unit.source: After the data factory has been created successfully, you will see the data factory page, which shows you the contents of the data factory.
trans-unit.target: After the data factory has been created successfully, you will see the data factory page, which shows you the contents of the data factory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data Factory blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data Factory blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the subsequent steps, you will learn how to create the linked services, datasets and pipeline that you will use in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In the subsequent steps, you will learn how to create the linked services, datasets and pipeline that you will use in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will link your Azure Storage account and an on-demand Azure HDInsight cluster to your data factory and then create a dataset to represent the output data from Hive processing.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will link your Azure Storage account and an on-demand Azure HDInsight cluster to your data factory and then create a dataset to represent the output data from Hive processing.

trans-unit.source: Click Author and deploy on the DATA FACTORY blade for DataFactoryFirstPipeline.
trans-unit.target: Click Author and deploy on the DATA FACTORY blade for DataFactoryFirstPipeline.

trans-unit.source: This launches the Data Factory Editor.
trans-unit.target: This launches the Data Factory Editor.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Author and deploy tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Author and deploy tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New data store and choose Azure storage
trans-unit.target: Click New data store and choose Azure storage

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage linked service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage linked service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You should see the JSON script for creating an Azure Storage linked service in the editor.
trans-unit.target: You should see the JSON script for creating an Azure Storage linked service in the editor.

trans-unit.source: Replace account name with the name of your Azure storage account and account key with the access key of the Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: Replace account name with the name of your Azure storage account and account key with the access key of the Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to get your storage access key, see <linkText>View, copy and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: To learn how to get your storage access key, see <linkText>View, copy and regenerate storage access keys</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now, you will create a linked service for an on-demand HDInsight cluster that will be used to run the Hive script.
trans-unit.target: Now, you will create a linked service for an on-demand HDInsight cluster that will be used to run the Hive script.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute on the command bar and select On-demand HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click New compute on the command bar and select On-demand HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New compute</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New compute</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.

trans-unit.source: The JSON snippet describes the properties that will be used to create the HDInsight cluster on-demand.
trans-unit.target: The JSON snippet describes the properties that will be used to create the HDInsight cluster on-demand.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides descriptions for the JSON properties used in the snippet:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides descriptions for the JSON properties used in the snippet:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description -------- | ----------- Version | This specifies that the version of the HDInsight created to be 3.1.
trans-unit.target: Property | Description -------- | ----------- Version | This specifies that the version of the HDInsight created to be 3.1.

trans-unit.source: ClusterSize | This creates a one node HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: ClusterSize | This creates a one node HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: TimeToLive | This specifies that the idle time for the HDInsight cluster, before it is deleted.
trans-unit.target: TimeToLive | This specifies that the idle time for the HDInsight cluster, before it is deleted.

trans-unit.source: JobsContainer | This specifies the name of the job container that will be created to store the logs that are generated by HDInsight linkedServiceName | This specifies the storage account that will be used to store the logs that are generated by HDInsight
trans-unit.target: JobsContainer | This specifies the name of the job container that will be created to store the logs that are generated by HDInsight linkedServiceName | This specifies the storage account that will be used to store the logs that are generated by HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the linked service.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see both StorageLinkedService and HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService in the tree view on the left.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see both StorageLinkedService and HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService in the tree view on the left.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Tree view with linked services</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Tree view with linked services</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now, you will create the output dataset to represent the data stored in the Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Now, you will create the output dataset to represent the data stored in the Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click New dataset on the command bar and select Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click New dataset on the command bar and select Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New dataset</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New dataset</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.

trans-unit.source: In the JSON snippet, you are creating a dataset called AzureBlobOutput, and specifying the structure of the data that will be produced by the Hive script.
trans-unit.target: In the JSON snippet, you are creating a dataset called AzureBlobOutput, and specifying the structure of the data that will be produced by the Hive script.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you specify that the results are stored in the blob container called data and the folder called partitioneddata.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you specify that the results are stored in the blob container called data and the folder called partitioneddata.

trans-unit.source: The availability section specifies that the output dataset is produced on a monthly basis.
trans-unit.target: The availability section specifies that the output dataset is produced on a monthly basis.

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the newly created dataset.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the newly created dataset.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the dataset is created successfully.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the dataset is created successfully.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Tree view with linked services</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Tree view with linked services</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create your first pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create your first pipeline.

trans-unit.source: In the Data Factory Editor, click Elipsis (…) and then click New pipeline.
trans-unit.target: In the Data Factory Editor, click Elipsis (…) and then click New pipeline.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>new pipeline button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>new pipeline button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the snippet below to the Draft-1 window.

trans-unit.source: Replace storageaccountname with the name of your storage account in the JSON.
trans-unit.target: Replace storageaccountname with the name of your storage account in the JSON.

trans-unit.source: In the JSON snippet, you are creating a pipeline that consists of a single activity that uses Hive to process Data on an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In the JSON snippet, you are creating a pipeline that consists of a single activity that uses Hive to process Data on an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Hive script file, partitionweblogs.hql, is stored in the Azure storage account (specified by the scriptLinkedService, called StorageLinkedService), and in a container called script.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script file, partitionweblogs.hql, is stored in the Azure storage account (specified by the scriptLinkedService, called StorageLinkedService), and in a container called script.

trans-unit.source: The extendedProperties section is used to specify the runtime settings that will be passed to the hive script as Hive configuration values (e.g ${hiveconf:PartitionedData}).
trans-unit.target: The extendedProperties section is used to specify the runtime settings that will be passed to the hive script as Hive configuration values (e.g ${hiveconf:PartitionedData}).

trans-unit.source: The start and end properties of the pipeline specifies the active period of the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The start and end properties of the pipeline specifies the active period of the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: In the activity JSON, you specify that the Hive script runs on the compute specified by the linked service – HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: In the activity JSON, you specify that the Hive script runs on the compute specified by the linked service – HDInsightOnDemandLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Click Deploy on the command bar to deploy the pipeline.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that you see the pipeline in the tree view.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that you see the pipeline in the tree view.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Tree view with pipeline</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Tree view with pipeline</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you have successfully created your first pipeline!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have successfully created your first pipeline!

trans-unit.source: Click X to close Data Factory Editor blades and to navigate back to the Data Factory blade, and click on Diagram.
trans-unit.target: Click X to close Data Factory Editor blades and to navigate back to the Data Factory blade, and click on Diagram.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Diagram View, you will see an overview of the pipelines, and datasets used in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In the Diagram View, you will see an overview of the pipelines, and datasets used in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Diagram View</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Diagram View</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Diagram View, double-click on the dataset AzureBlobOutput.
trans-unit.target: In the Diagram View, double-click on the dataset AzureBlobOutput.

trans-unit.source: You will see that the slice that is currently being processed.
trans-unit.target: You will see that the slice that is currently being processed.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dataset</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dataset</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When processing is done, you will see the slice in Ready state.
trans-unit.target: When processing is done, you will see the slice in Ready state.

trans-unit.source: Note that the creation of an on-demand HDInsight cluster usually takes sometime.
trans-unit.target: Note that the creation of an on-demand HDInsight cluster usually takes sometime.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dataset</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dataset</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the slice is in Ready state, check the partitioneddata folder in the data container in your blob storage for the output data.
trans-unit.target: When the slice is in Ready state, check the partitioneddata folder in the data container in your blob storage for the output data.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have created a pipeline with a transformation activity (HDInsight Activity) that runs a Hive script on an on-demand HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have created a pipeline with a transformation activity (HDInsight Activity) that runs a Hive script on an on-demand HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To see how to use a Copy Activity to copy data from an Azure Blob to Azure SQL, see <linkText>Tutorial: Copy data from an Azure blob to Azure SQL</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To see how to use a Copy Activity to copy data from an Azure Blob to Azure SQL, see <linkText>Tutorial: Copy data from an Azure blob to Azure SQL</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.

trans-unit.source: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via <linkText>email</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Please take a few minutes to submit your feedback via <linkText>email</linkText><title></title>.
